q: on slavery NEW YORK- Award-winning historian Eric Foner has received a new honor, the Abraham Lincoln Prize, for his biography about the 16th president's views on slavery. Eric Foner will receive$ 50,000 for The Fiery Trial: Abraham Lincoln and American Slavery. He is best known for "Reconstruction," published in 1988 and winner of the Bancroft Prize. release for Martin Luther King Day doesn't have much to do with civil rights, strictly speaking. It addresses the shooting of Rep. Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona and the rhetorical and budgetary attacks on public employees of recent months. ALBANY, NY( 01/14/2011)- The recent horrific events in Tuscon have saddened us all. However, from every tragedy lessons can be learned and the attention given by many to the contribution of violent rhetoric as cause for the shootings may be just the opening to bring civility back to our public discourse. I am further bolstered by the genuine joy expressed by U.S. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand in her account of the awakening of her friend and colleague Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords during a visit to the shooting victim's hospital room.
